Sentencas: This study investigates dimethyl ether (DME) as a potential fuel for proton-conducting SOFCs with a conventional nickel cermet anode and a BaZr0.4Ce0.4Y0.2O3-delta (BZCY4) electrolyte.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: A catalytic test demonstrates that the sintered Ni + BZCY4 anode has an acceptable catalytic activity for the decomposition and steam reforming of DME with CO, CH4 and CO2 as the only gaseous carbon-containing products.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: An O-2-TPO analysis demonstrates the presence of a large amount of coke formation over the anode catalyst when operating on pure DME, which is effectively suppressed by introducing steam into the fuel gas.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: The selectivity towards CH4 is also obviously reduced.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: Peak power densities of 252, 280 and 374 mW cm(-2) are achieved for the cells operating on pure DME, a DME + H2O gas mixture (1:3) and hydrogen at 700 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: After the test, the cell operating on pure DME is seriously cracked whereas the cell operating on DME + H2O maintains its original integrity.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: A lower power output is obtained for the cell operating on DME + H2O than on H-2 at low temperature, which is mainly due to the increased electrode polarization resistance.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether

Sentencas: The selection of a better proton-conducting phase in the anode is critical to further increase the cell power output.
Titulo: Study on proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells with a conventional nickel cermet anode operating on dimethyl ether
